Children would use household items as toys: If all toys disappeared, children would have to get creative and use everyday household items as toys. This could include using paper clips, cardboard boxes, rubber bands, and even household cleaning supplies like brooms and mops as playthings.
Imaginary play: Children could use their imagination to create their own toys and games. They could use their imagination to create their own characters, stories, and adventures.
Outdoor play: Children could spend more time outdoors playing in nature. They could go on hikes, build forts, and explore their surroundings.
Creative art projects: Children could spend their time creating art projects using materials like paper, paint, and clay.
Building and construction: Children could spend their time building and constructing things using materials like blocks, LEGOs, and other building materials.
